DataElement.preferredName: Adapted WLQ Past 4 Weeks How Much of the Time Did Caregiving Responsibilities Make it Difficult to Repeat Same Motions Repeatedly While Working 6 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A person's stated observation of how much of the time they were able to repeat the same motions over and over again while working, without difficulty caused by their caregiving responsibilities, using a 6 point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Change WLQ Past 4 Weeks How Much of the Time Did Caregiving Responsibilities Make it Difficult to Repeat Same Motions Repeatedly While Working
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The act of alteration or modification; changed or altered in form or character._A standardized rating scale originally developed by Lerner et al in 1998. This instrument is used to measure the degree to which health problems interfere with specific aspects of job performance and health-related productivity loss in employed individuals._A period of time consisting of the 28 days before the present._A question about how much of the time something is occurring or has occurred._A question about if an individual was able to repeat the same motions over and over again while working, without difficulty caused by caregiving responsibilities.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The act of alteration or modification; changed or altered in form or character.:A standardized rating scale originally developed by Lerner et al in 1998. This instrument is used to measure the degree to which health problems interfere with specific aspects of job performance and health-related productivity loss in employed individuals.

Concepts.definition: The act of alteration or modification; changed or altered in form or character.

A standardized rating scale originally developed by Lerner et al in 1998. This instrument is used to measure the degree to which health problems interfere with specific aspects of job performance and health-related productivity loss in employed individuals.
